text: Behcet's is a multi-system disease; it may involve all organs and affect the central nervous system, causing memory loss and impaired speech, balance, and movement. The effects of the disease may include blindness, stroke, swelling of the spinal cord, and intestinal complications. The Human Phenotype Ontology provides the following list of signs and symptoms for Behcet's disease. If the information is available, the table below includes how often the symptom is seen in people with this condition
